alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:39PM EST until February 19 at 8:01AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 30.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Saturday was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and continue falling to 4.1 feet by Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.2 feet on 02/21/2019. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 6 a.m. Sunday morning.
